definition: also known as "Auto", is the first 15 seconds of the match when the robots are completely driverless, running on pre-programmed instructions. This was used prior to 2019.

when a team builds a robot part, not for their robot, but for an alliance partner. For example building a blocker to put on a partner robot in a match.
FRC team 254 from California, one of the best teams in the world.
A forum for teams around the world to ask and answer questions.
A motor usually used in drive trains.
Preventing the other alliance from scoring; varies from year to year.
The final field at champs.

a night roughly a month after school begins. The team gives a 1 hour presentation about KnightKrawler for new students who are interested in joining the team.
A person who makes sure that robots are safe and legal.
Offseason competition in November hosted by FRC Team 2169.
Short for "Minnesota Robotics Invitational", MRI is an offseason competition hosted by FRC Team 2846.
The first 15 seconds of the match. Robots can be autonomous (see "Autonomous") or camera operated. New in 2019.
the last day teams are allowed to work on their robot during the 6 week build period, after which, they must put their robot in a bag until their first competition.
drill many holes to lose weight.
A practice competition hosted the last week of build season.
